plants.description: Tall annual grass with elongated stems, large narrow leaves, and edible seeds (kernels) that develop on a cob.
Annual legume with climbing or bush growth habit that produces edible pods and seeds.
Annual vine with large leaves and edible fruits.

interactions.mechanism_description: Beans fix nitrogen in the soil, which benefits corn, a heavy nitrogen feeder. Corn provides structural support for climbing bean varieties.

companion_relationships.notes: Part of the traditional 'Three Sisters' companion planting method used by Native Americans.

interactions.mechanism_description: Squash provides ground cover that suppresses weeds and retains soil moisture for corn. The prickly stems and leaves also deter pests.

companion_relationships.notes: Another component of the 'Three Sisters' planting method. Squash is typically planted around the perimeter of the corn and bean planting.

pests.description: Cream-colored caterpillar with a brown head that tunnels into corn stalks and ears.
pests.symptoms: Broken tassels, holes in stalks with sawdust-like frass, stunted growth, reduced yield.
pests.control_methods: Crop rotation, early planting, destruction of crop residue, biological controls, insecticides.

pests.description: Caterpillar that varies in color from green to brown with light stripes along the sides.
pests.symptoms: Damage to corn ears, especially at the tip, with visible frass and feeding damage.
pests.control_methods: Bt sprays, mineral oil application to silk, beneficial insects, resistant varieties.
